metadata.title: CVE-2016-5272 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The nsImageGeometryMixin class in Mozilla Firefox before 49.0, Firefox ESR45.x before 45.4, and Thunderbird < 45.4 does not properly perform a castof an unspecified variable during handling of INPUT elements, which allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5272` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
